Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bell, FansOff, FansOn, LightOff, LightOn, PowerOut, Terminate, ThermostatDay, ThermostatNight, WaterOff, WaterOn, WindowMalfunction

    public abstract class Event
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable
    Event Class - Provides methods to control the execution of Events as Threads
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Event()
      Event Default Constructor Allows for initialization of empty Events
      Event(long delayTime)
      Event Constructor Creates an Event object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void action()
      action() Default Method - Needs to be declared
      static void allowExecution()
      allowExecution() Method Allows Events to be executed.
      boolean getAttempt()
      getAttempt() Method Returns an Events attemptAction Used to check if an Event has attempted to run yet or not
      SystemState getState()
      getState() Method Returns the state from a SystemState Tuple
      void restartEvent()
      restartEvent() Method Resets executionTime and startTime.
      void resumeEvent()
      resumeEvent() Method Resumes Events from suspension.
      void run()
      run() Method Controls the execution of the event While system's current time is before the Event's execution time, run.
      void setAttempt()
      setAttempt() Method Sets attemptAction to true
      static void stopExecution()
      stopExecution() Method Stops Events from executing.
      void suspendEvent()
      suspendEvent() Method Suspends Events.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Event

        public Event()
        Event Default Constructor Allows for initialization of empty Events

      • Event

        public Event(long delayTime)
        Event Constructor Creates an Event object. Captures a delayTime to calculate when to run the Threads. Calculates executionTime and the time the Event started.
        Parameters:
        delayTime - The Event objects delayTime

    • Method Detail

      • resumeEvent

        public void resumeEvent()
        resumeEvent() Method Resumes Events from suspension. Calculates the execution time, sets suspended to false, and uses synchronized() to notify() all threads to start.

      • suspendEvent

        public void suspendEvent()
        suspendEvent() Method Suspends Events. Calculates the time it was suspended at and assigns it to suspendTime. Calculates the run time and assigns it to runTime. Sets suspended to true.

      • stopExecution

        public static void stopExecution()
        stopExecution() Method Stops Events from executing. Sets stopAll to true.

      • allowExecution

        public static void allowExecution()
        allowExecution() Method Allows Events to be executed. Sets stopAll to false.

      • restartEvent

        public void restartEvent()
        restartEvent() Method Resets executionTime and startTime. Sets stopAll to false. Calculates and assigns executionTime and startTime.

      • setAttempt

        public void setAttempt()
        setAttempt() Method Sets attemptAction to true

      • getState

        public SystemState getState()
        getState() Method Returns the state from a SystemState Tuple
        Returns:
        SystemState Tuple's state

      • getAttempt

        public boolean getAttempt()
        getAttempt() Method Returns an Events attemptAction Used to check if an Event has attempted to run yet or not
        Returns:
        Boolean attemptAction

      • action

        public abstract void action()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        action() Default Method - Needs to be declared
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if error occurs Exception is thrown
        See Also:
        Exception.Exception()

      • run

        public void run()
        run() Method Controls the execution of the event While system's current time is before the Event's execution time, run. If stopAll is true, then stop running. If suspended is true, then synchronize() wait() all threads
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
